answers.answer: With a TGab of 557, I sure hope you are on thyroid meds. What are your TSH, FT4, FT3 and TPOab levels?You, personally, should be concerned about getting treatment. Your TGab and nodules point to auto-immune thyroid disease.Has a doctor spoken to you about this? If not, then time for a good endocrinologist who specializes in thyroid, not diabetes.Do you have any symptoms? Tired, constipated, weight gain, dry skin, joint pain, brain fog, depression? Wired, rapid heart beat, diarrhea, weight loss, anxiety?:) Tamra

question: I have just read the paper about the alarming increase of thyroid cancer in NY state especially the communities near Indian Point Power Plant an 100% increase.  I live in central westchester county in which it has a 42% increase.  My  doctor after my second ultrasound and blood test said to me lets watch and see and see you in one year.  My ultrasound had slight changes from six months earlier and my blood test everything was normal except for the Thyroglobulin AB  was 557.  I have enlarged thyroid with 6 nodules one being2.3x2.00 x2.1cm. had FNA - negative.Should the health department be more concerned about this alrming rates?
title: Alarming rate of thyroid cancer
